MR No. 1061 - Additional Light for God's People

  (Written January 18, 1889, from Battle Creek, Michigan to R. A. Underwood) 


     You seem to be surprised that I look at matters in the light that I do. You speak of the resolution that you thought ought to have passed at the General Conference. What did that resolution comprehend? It virtually said that nothing should be taught in the college but that which had been taught during the past year. . . .
